doc:doc.doc:summary: Get a list of display IDs with brightness controls available.
doc:doc.doc:para: Per-display methods take a display ID as parameter.

doc:doc.doc:summary: The display whose brightness controls became newly available.
The display whose brightness controls became unavailable.
Adjust display brightness for a predetermined set of displays by a delta between -1.0 and 1.0.
Boolean options, combined in a single value with binary OR (pass 0 for default behavior).

doc:list.doc:item: 0x1: SuppressIndicator - don't show brightness change indicators such as OSD, notification, etc. ("silent mode").

doc:doc.doc:summary: Adjust display brightness for a predetermined set of displays by a delta between -1.0 and 1.0, with extra context passthrough.
doc:doc.doc:para: Arguments other than source_client_context are the same as in AdjustBrightnessRatio.

doc:doc.doc:summary: Will be passed through to any resulting BrightnessChanged signal.
Adjust display brightness for a predetermined set of displays by a step up or down the brightness scale.
The direction and size of the step

doc:para.doc:item: 0: Increase - raise brightness by a regular step.
1: Decrease - lower brightness by a regular step.
2: IncreaseSmall - raise brightness by a small step.
3: DecreaseSmall - lower brightness by a small step.

doc:doc.doc:summary: Boolean options, combined in a single value with binary OR (pass 0 for default behavior).

doc:list.doc:item: 0x1: SuppressIndicator - don't show brightness change indicators such as OSD, notification, etc. ("silent mode").

doc:doc.doc:summary: Adjust display brightness for a predetermined set of displays by a step up or down the brightness scale, with extra context passthrough.
doc:doc.doc:para: Arguments other than source_client_context are the same as in AdjustBrightnessStep.

doc:doc.doc:summary: Will be passed through to any resulting BrightnessChanged signal.
Get a user-visible name for a given display.
Returns true if the display is part of the system itself (e.g. laptop panel), false if external (e.g. monitor, drawing tablet) or unknown.
Get the maximum brightness value for a given display.
Get the current brightness value for a given display, in the range from 0 (the lowest still-visible brightness level) to GetMaxBrightness.
doc:doc.doc:para: Note that not all external brightness changes can be observed. The actual screen brightness may be a different one than the one returned by this function.

doc:doc.doc:summary: Set the brightness for a given display.
The requested brightness value in the range from 0 (the lowest still-visible brightness) to GetMaxBrightness.
Boolean options, combined in a single value with binary OR (pass 0 for default behavior).

doc:list.doc:item: 0x1: SuppressIndicator - don't show brightness change indicators such as OSD, notification, etc. ("silent mode").

doc:doc.doc:summary: Set the brightness for a given display, with extra context passthrough.
doc:doc.doc:para: Arguments other than source_client_context are the same as in SetBrightness.

doc:doc.doc:summary: Will be passed through to any resulting BrightnessChanged signal.
The display for which a brightness change was performed or observed.
The updated brightness value.
doc:doc.doc:para: Note that not all types of displays allow external brightness changes. The actual screen brightness may be a different one than the one that was last emitted by this signal.

doc:doc.doc:summary: The client (bus address) that requested the brightness change.
The context string passed through from a brightness change method, or an empty string if no context was passed.
The display for which the brightness range changed.
The updated maximum brightness value.
The current brightness value within the updated scale from 0 to max_brightness.
